perturbation.original_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur. 3. By either Party for a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party, if the other Party's material breach is not cured within three (3) days of receipt of written notice thereof. This shall include any delays to the timeline specified in Exhibit A. 4. By the Client at any time and without prior notice, if the Developer is convicted of any crime or offense, fails or refuses to comply with the written policies or reasonable directives of the Client, or is guilty of serious misconduct in connection with performance under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur, unless the client is facing financial hardship. 3. By either Party for a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party, if the other Party's material breach is not cured within three (3) days of receipt of written notice thereof. This shall include any delays to the timeline specified in Exhibit A, unless previously agreed upon. 4. By the Client at any time and without prior notice, if the Developer is convicted of any crime or offense, fails or refuses to comply with the written policies or reasonable directives of the Client, or is guilty of serious misconduct in connection with performance under this Agreement, subject to a 30-day review period.
perturbation.explanation: The changes introduce exceptions that contradict the original termination terms. Adding 'unless the client is facing financial hardship' to the developer's right to cancel creates ambiguity. Likewise, 'unless previously agreed upon' weakens the material breach clause. Introducing a '30-day review period' before termination for developer misconduct contradicts the 'at any time and without prior notice' clause.

perturbation.original_text: 14. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY. (a) No Intellectual Property Infringement by Developer. The Developer hereby represents and warrants that the use and proposed use of the Application by the Client or any third party does not and shall not infringe, and the Developer has not received any notice, complaint, threat, or claim alleging infringement of, any trademark, copyright, patent, trade secrets, industrial design, or other rights of any third party in the Application, and the use of the Application will not include any activity that may constitute "passing off." To the extent the Application infringes on the rights of any such third party, the Developer shall obtain a license or consent from such third party permitting the use of the Application. It is hereby stated, the Application developed under this agreement is the exclusive worldwide sole property of Client.
perturbation.changed_text: 14. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY. (a) No Intellectual Property Infringement by Developer. The Developer hereby represents and warrants that the use and proposed use of the Application by the Client or any third party does not and shall not infringe, and the Developer has not received any notice, complaint, threat, or claim alleging infringement of, any trademark, copyright, patent, trade secrets, industrial design, or other rights of any third party in the Application, and the use of the Application will not include any activity that may constitute "passing off." To the extent the Application infringes on the rights of any such third party, the Developer shall use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain a license or consent from such third party permitting the use of the Application. It is hereby stated, the Application developed under this agreement is the exclusive worldwide sole property of Client, except for any third-party components incorporated into it.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall obtain a license' to 'shall use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain a license' weakens the developer's obligation. Adding 'except for any third-party components incorporated into it' contradicts the statement that the application is the 'exclusive worldwide sole property of Client' and raises questions about ownership.

perturbation.original_text:
G. PAYMENT SCHEDULE. The total cost for the development of the project is $ 480,000. - Developer has accepted 4,122,394 shares of Clients common stock in exchange for $180,000 worth of services to be provided. The Shares were paid to INFX Development, LLC. (Certificate # 1054) and accepted by Developer as payment on December 30t h, 2019 Client will form subsidiary and register the new business if necessary.

The Client agrees to pay to the Developer for the development of the project as listed above, the amount of the other $300,000. - according to the following schedule:
● $30,000. - down payment.
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 2).
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 6).
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 9).
● $30,000.- mid payment Week 12).
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 16).
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 20).
● $90,000.- following Client acceptance of the Application, and when RC1 version is delivered and uploaded to stores.
perturbation.changed_text:
G. PAYMENT SCHEDULE. The total cost for the development of the project is $ 480,000. - Developer has accepted 4,122,394 shares of Clients common stock in exchange for $180,000 worth of services to be provided. The Shares were paid to INFX Development, LLC. (Certificate # 1054) and accepted by Developer as payment on December 30t h, 2019 Client will form subsidiary and register the new business if necessary.

The Client agrees to pay to the Developer for the development of the project as listed above, the amount of the other $300,000. - according to the following schedule, subject to the Client's financial performance:
● $30,000. - down payment, unless otherwise negotiated.
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 2), contingent on milestone approval.
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 6), contingent on milestone approval.
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 9), contingent on milestone approval.
● $30,000.- mid payment Week 12), contingent on milestone approval.
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 16), contingent on milestone approval.
● $30,000.- mid payment (Week 20), contingent on milestone approval.
● $90,000.- following Client acceptance of the Application, and when RC1 version is delivered and uploaded to stores, pending final audit.
perturbation.explanation: Introducing 'subject to the Client's financial performance' and 'unless otherwise negotiated' adds uncertainty to the fixed payment schedule. Adding 'contingent on milestone approval' creates a subjective condition that can delay payment. Adding 'pending final audit' before the final payment also adds ambiguity and could allow for delayed or reduced payment. This introduces conflict regarding payment schedule.
